description: This blocks allows you to Analyze an image, Read text in images, Generate a thumbnail

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: image
args.info: Supported input methods: raw image binary or image URL.

args.name: details
args.info: Optional: A string indicating which domain-specific details to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: Celebrities.

args.name: visualFeatures
args.info: Optional: A string indicating what visual feature types to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: Categories, Tags, Description, Faces, Color, Adult.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: image
args.info: Supported input methods: raw image binary or image URL.

args.name: maxCandidates
args.info: Optional: Maximum number of candidate descriptions to be returned. The default is 1.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: image
args.info: Supported input methods: raw image binary or image URL.

args.name: width
args.info: Width of the thumbnail. It must be between 1 and 1024. Recommended minimum of 50.

args.name: height
args.info: Height of the thumbnail. It must be between 1 and 1024. Recommended minimum of 50.

args.name: smartCropping
args.info: Optional: Boolean flag for enabling smart cropping.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: image
args.info: Supported input methods: raw image binary or image URL.

args.name: language
args.info: Optional: The BCP-47 language code of the text to be detected in the image.The default value is 'unk', then the service will auto detect the language of the text in the image. Supported languages: unk (AutoDetect), zh-Hans (ChineseSimplified), zh-Hant (ChineseTraditional), cs (Czech), da (Danish), nl (Dutch), en (English), fi (Finnish), fr (French), de (German), el (Greek), hu (Hungarian), it (Italian), Ja (Japanese), ko (Korean), nb (Norwegian), pl (Polish), pt (Portuguese, ru (Russian), es (Spanish), sv (Swedish), tr (Turkish).

args.name: detectOrientation
args.info: Optional: Whether detect the text orientation in the image. With detectOrientation=true the OCR service tries to detect the image orientation and correct it before further processing (e.g. if it's upside-down).
